title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 00:15  
jvelociter - (00:25): cjdelisle`: yahoo compressor is only for extensions  
jvelociter - (00:25): other JS code is compressed at build time  
jvelociter - (00:25): personnally, I'd be for concatenating all JS at build time (except extensions, of course)  
jvelociter - (00:25): so that we send just one file  
jvelociter - (00:26): (maybe now that many scripts use defer, it's less an issue though - still I'd be curious to measure the cost of sending 20 files instead of just a couple)  
jvelociter - (00:27): we could also concatenate extensions at run time  
jvelociter - (00:27): that's a bit more tricky for the caches  
jvelociter - (00:27): but doable  
jvelociter - (00:28): (we could at least concatenate the "always use" ones)  
florinciu left at 00:35 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
SvenDowideit\_ left at 01:12 (Changing host  
SvenDowideit\_ joined #xwiki at 01:12  
SvenDowideit\_ is now known as SvenDowideit (~SvenDowid@foswiki/developer/SvenDowideit  
cjdelisle` - (01:16): concatenating definitely helps. I spent some time working on developing a js/css server but I didn't really want to press on until the new model for actions was done.  
cjdelisle` - (01:17): Then nobody knows how to make actions work with portlets and servlets and depending on servlets is a -1 so that's blocked until further notice.  
sdumitriu - (01:17): Indeed  
cjdelisle` - (01:41): hey, someone should commit and make some test regressions. I have the regression alert mailer pointed at my address and I'm waiting to get a couple messages before I point it at the notification list.  
cjdelisle` - (01:41): ;)  
jvelociter - (01:42): hmmm what could we break ?  
jvelociter - (01:43): what about xwiki#getDocument ?  
jvelociter - (01:43): :)  
cjdelisle` - (01:43): noone needs that for anything.

fmancinelli - (19:26): Quick question: in a velocity script is there a way for creating instances of java.net.URI ?  
sabageru1 left at 19:31 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
fmancinelli - (19:39): And another one: if I have a string "xwiki:Space.Name" how can I get the URL corresponding to the page? (always in a velocity script)  
fmancinelli - (20:08): ok, for the second one I used the deprecated method $xwiki.getURL("xwiki:Space.Name", "view")  
vmassol - (20:22): fmancinelli: why do you need URI?  
vmassol - (20:22): normally apis for velocity shouldn't require uri  
vmassol - (20:22): (at least that's one way of solving it)  
vmassol - (20:23): (now the question is whether we want all script service apis to not have uri thus potentially penalizing other scripting language - we'll need to solve this at some point, probably with type transformer uberspectors)  
fmancinelli - (20:31): I need it for passing a URI to a function (that is not part of the xwiki API)  
vmassol - (20:31): fmancinelli: so you could accept a string instead of a uri maybe?  
vmassol - (20:31): (or put a velocity tool in the velocity context)  
fmancinelli - (20:36): yes, maybe I'll put a tool in the context  
fmancinelli - (20:36): thanks  
vmassol - (20:37): you could use a Velocity listener for that  
vmassol - (20:37): (fmancinelli)  
vmassol - (20:37): in order to not have to modify the configuration file  
vmassol - (20:38): VelocityContextInitializer  
fmancinelli - (20:39): ok  
vmassol - (20:39): got to go, bye  
vmassol left at 20:39 (Quit: Leaving.  
cjdelisle left at 20:57 (Quit: look for a less laggy server  
cjdelisle` joined #xwiki at 20:58  
jbrBridge - (21:00): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Where can I find this xwikibot? I would like to include it in my site :-)  
cjdelisle` - (21:02): Here is a copy of it built http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/applications/xwiki-application-ircbot/  
cjdelisle` - (21:02): it will take some effort to get it to work though, it was designed to be used in house only.  
cjdelisle` - (21:04): It might be worth considering including the bot in XE by default. If xwiki.org needs it and you need it then there is obvious need.  
sburjan` - (21:10): cjdelisle`: who coded the bot ?  
cjdelisle` - (21:10): vmassol  
sburjan` - (21:10): and do you have any idea how the events are transmitted to the bot ?  
jbrBridge - (21:10): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] I think it ist helpful monitoring content changes on a website.  
jbrBridge - (21:10): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] But I would prefer to use a jabber conference room. It would give a better control who have access without restrict it to  
jbrBridge - (21:11): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] use it only in an intranet.  
cjdelisle` - (21:11): the bot is based on pircbot.  
cjdelisle` - (21:12): I think anything which can be done in jabber can also be done in irc.  
sburjan` - (21:12): yes..  
sburjan` - (21:12): but how does it actually communicate with XE ?  
cjdelisle` - (21:12): And my little rant: the jabber server has less stability than my desktop (this is before I started using ipredator mind you)  
cjdelisle` - (21:13): IRC is a more solid protocol for whatever reason.  
sburjan` - (21:14): well.. it was used by the DoD :)  
sburjan` - (21:14): it's a solid protocol, that's why I like ircing  
cjdelisle` - (21:14): If you want to make the bot available to jabber, you can use a bridge like ircBridge/jbrBridge  
cjdelisle` - (21:15): That bridge is a perl program called jirc. Written by kevin kees IIRC.  
cjdelisle` - (21:15): s/kees/cook/  
cjdelisle` - (21:15): I think...  
cjdelisle` - (21:16): kees cook.  
cjdelisle` - (21:16): lol fail  
cjdelisle` - (21:16): http://outflux.net/software/pkgs/jirc-bridge/  
cjdelisle` - (21:17): So if you only use jabber then you can drop a ratbox on localhost and connect the bot to it and a jirc instance and it will bounce to jabber.
